page.title: 05ROYAL COMMISSION INVENTORIES
page.content: On this page we deal with the inventories produced by the Royal Commision on Historical Monuments.The following list is by Parishes. {Stinsford:}Bockhampton Bridge is late 18th to 19th century and Hardys Cottage is late 18th century. {Puddletown:}Islington Farm dates from the 19th century but is said to incorporate bits of an older building. There are a number of Tumili on the heathland. The most significant are the Rainbarrows on the edge of Duddle heath. {West Stafford:}The bridge is dated at 1733,but it is noted that the eastern parapet has date stone of 1807. West Stafford house was originally known as Frome House and was the manor house of the settlement "Frome Belet".This was built in 1633.
